蕭一山.definition: Xiao Yishan (1902-1978), Modern historian of the Qing dynasty

蕭乾.definition: Xiao Qian (1910-1999), Mongolian-born, Cambridge-educated journalist active during Second World War in Europe, subsequently famous author and translator

蕭伯納.definition: George Bernard Shaw (1856-1950), Irish dramatist and writer

蕭何.definition: Xiao He (-193 BC), famous strategist and chancellor, fought on Liu Bang's 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] side during the Chu-Han Contention 楚漢戰爭|楚汉战争[Chu3 Han4 Zhan4 zheng1]

蕭子顯.definition: Xiao Zixian (487-537), writer and historian of Liang of Southern Dynasties, compiler of History of Qi of the Southern dynasties 南齊書|南齐书[Nan2 Qi2 shu1]

蕭山.definition: Xiaoshan district of Hangzhou city 杭州市[Hang2 zhou1 shi4], Zhejiang

蕭山區.definition: Xiaoshan district of Hangzhou city 杭州市[Hang2 zhou1 shi4], Zhejiang

蕭條.definition: bleak; desolate; (economics) in a slump; sluggish; depressed

蕭灑.definition: variant of 瀟灑|潇洒[xiao1 sa3]

蕭牆.definition: (literary) screen wall shielding an entrance in traditional Chinese architecture

蕭瑟.definition: to rustle in the air; to rustle; to sough; bleak; desolate; chilly

蕭紅.definition: Xiao Hong (1911-1942), prominent woman writer, originally from Heilongjiang

蕭縣.definition: Xiao County or Xiaoxian, a county in Suzhou 宿州[Su4zhou1], Anhui

蕭萬長.definition: Vincent C. Siew (1939-), Taiwanese diplomat and Kuomintang politician, prime minister 1997-2000, vice president 2008-2012

蕭規曹隨.definition: lit. Xiao's 蕭何|萧何[Xiao1 He2] governance followed by Cao 曹參|曹参[Cao2 Can1] (idiom); fig. to strictly adhere to the policies of the predecessor; to follow precedent

蕭邦.definition: (Tw) Frédéric Chopin (1810-1849), Polish pianist and composer
